oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside for the political campaign of John Bell. On the broadside is a campaign song. A bell is pictured at top.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Handbills; Political campaigns
Bell, John, 1797-1869; Presidential candidates; Constitutional Union Party (U.S.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Bell (February 15, 1797 - September 10, 1869) was a U.S. politician, attorney, and plantation owner. A wealthy slaveholder from Tennessee, Bell served in the United States Congress in both the House of Representatives and Senate. He began his career as a Democrat, but eventually fell out with Andrew Jackson and became a Whig. In 1860, he was among a group of Presidential candidates defeated by Abraham Lincoln in a bitterly divided election.
